title: If setUpBeforeClass() fails, test failures are hidden in PHPUnit's JUnit XML output
body:
If setUpBeforeClass() throws an exception, no failures or errors are reported in the PHPUnit's JUnit XML output.

Example test class:

```
<?php

class Test extends PHPUnit_Framework_TestCase
{
  public static function setUpBeforeClass() {
    throw new \Exception('masks all failures in xml output');
  }

  public function testFoo() {
    $this->fail('failing');
  }
}
```

Command line:

<!-- language: lang-sh -->

```
phpunit --verbose --log-junit out.xml Test.php
```

Console output:

<!-- language: lang-none -->

```
PHPUnit 3.6.10 by Sebastian Bergmann.

E

Time: 0 seconds, Memory: 3.25Mb

There was 1 error:

1) Test
Exception: masks all failures in xml output

/tmp/pu/Test.php:6

FAILURES!
Tests: 0, Assertions: 0, Errors: 1.
```

JUnit XML output:

<!-- language: lang-xml -->

```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<testsuites>
  <testsuite name="Test" file="/tmp/phpunit-broken/Test.php"/>
</testsuites>
```

More info:

<!-- language: lang-none -->

```
$ php --version
```
